product_description: Marble's natural aesthetic reimagined in a strikingly contemporary style

product_categories.category_name: External Wall Claddings and Facades and systems
Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

price_adjustment_structure: Priced based on m2 purchased, starting from $138/m2 inc. GST
lead_time: Usually available immediately on site at Smithfield
recyclable_percentage_description: Available through third party recycling facilities
recyclable_offcuts_description: They can be crushed and used as concrete aggregates or road construction.
recycling_process_description: After demolition and deconstruction, ceramic tiles can be crushed and used in a wide range of different applications, such as concrete aggregates or road construction.
water_reduction_techniques: 100% - In Marazzi Group plants, all industrial water is completely recycled back into production.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts or wastage, it is recommended to consider the layout, design and size of the tile
modern_slavery_comments: The Group has committed to identifying, managing and mitigating modern slavery risks in their supply chain. More information can be found through their Modern Slavery Report in Australia. Other impacts can be found in their impact report.
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral found in many types of rock and soil, and therefore  is found in many construction materials including tiles.  Please contact us for more information.

manufacturing_locations.location_name: Fiorano Modenese, Province of Modena, Italy

material_locations.material: Raw materials (including quartz, mullite, feldspar, zirconium and corundum)

other_comments: Our mission is to drive change in our industry by making a conscious effort to shift the way in which we source and procure products.
type_of_packaging: The slabs are placed by means of automatic suction cups on trestles or inside wooden crates which, once completed, are picked up by laser-guided vehicles and transported to a storage area where airbags are placed inside the crate on the sides of the slabs or cardboard corners on the sides of the slabs placed on the trestle. The packaging is placed on roller conveyors, through which it is hooded by applying a suitable cap and then conveyed to the oven for the application of shrink film.

product_description: Marble's natural aesthetic reimagined in a strikingly contemporary style

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

price_adjustment_structure: Priced based on m2 purchased, starting from $91/m2 inc. GST
lead_time: Usually available immediately on site at Smithfield
recyclable_percentage_description: Available through third party recycling facilities
recyclable_offcuts_description: They can be crushed and used as concrete aggregates or road construction.
recycling_process_description: After demolition and deconstruction, ceramic tiles can be crushed and used in a wide range of different applications, such as concrete aggregates or road construction.
water_reduction_techniques: 100% - In Marazzi Group plants, all industrial water is completely recycled back into production.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts or wastage, it is recommended to consider the layout, design and size of the tile
modern_slavery_comments: The Group has committed to identifying, managing and mitigating modern slavery risks in their supply chain. More information can be found through their Modern Slavery Report in Australia. Other impacts can be found in their impact report.
installation_risks_description: Silica is a naturally occurring mineral found in many types of rock and soil, and therefore  is found in many construction materials including tiles.  Please contact us for more information.

material_locations.material: Raw materials (including clay, sand and feldspar)

other_comments: Our mission is to drive change in our industry by making a conscious effort to shift the way in which we source and procure products.
type_of_packaging: The tiles are packed in cardboard boxes, wrapped in polyethylene film and plastic strapping, and then stacked on wooden pallets. The amount of packaging material can vary depending on the size of the tiles. The cardboard and the PET film used for the packaging of the final product contain recycled material.
